comments.body: why do we change `PreserveUnknownFields` to `bool` from `*bool` in v1?
We default to false and want to avoid serializing false values
I see. That's how we hide the field as we planned in the KEP
I assume there's an identical variant of this for v1beta1?  i.e. units guard this already in other versions?

internal and v1beta1 types match fields, so the conversion is just auto-generated.

v1beta1 defaulting ensures that empty version/versions are defaulted:
https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/32dc42ed34eb5ca97bd8fa4544d9a91d6b05a310/staging/src/k8s.io/apiextensions-apiserver/pkg/apis/apiextensions/v1beta1/defaults.go#L52-L63

validation ensures that spec.version matches spec.versions[0].name:
https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/32dc42ed34eb5ca97bd8fa4544d9a91d6b05a310/staging/src/k8s.io/apiextensions-apiserver/pkg/apis/apiextensions/validation/validation.go#L236-L238

and that spec.versions are specified:
https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/32dc42ed34eb5ca97bd8fa4544d9a91d6b05a310/staging/src/k8s.io/apiextensions-apiserver/pkg/apis/apiextensions/validation/validation.go#L185-L191

https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/32dc42ed34eb5ca97bd8fa4544d9a91d6b05a310/staging/src/k8s.io/apiextensions-apiserver/pkg/apis/apiextensions/validation/validation.go#L229-L231
and there's extensive validation and defaulting units for v1beta1
